hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Reversal Catalyst in Stress Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: In STRESS regimes (high volatility, negative funding), consecutive ETF outflows >$300M will trigger amplified selling pressure where BTC underperforms traditional risk assets (SPY) by 1.5-2.0x during the following 24 hours, as ETF arbitrage desks unwind positions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes magnify flow-based catalysts. ETF outflows force authorized participants to sell spot BTC to hedge, creating amplified downward pressure. News mentions 'ETF outflows' as current concern, suggesting market sensitivity.
entry_conditions: 2+ consecutive days of BTC ETF outflows > $150M/day

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC-SPY relative performance reaches -2.0% OR 24 hours elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETF flows turn positive (>$50M inflow) OR BTC-SPY correlation reverts positive

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Large ETF outflows in stress regime fail to generate relative underperformance vs SPY, or BTC decouples positively from traditional markets.
